title: Missing snappy-c.h when trying to install trinity.
body:
* py-evm Version: whatever is the version being pulled by pip.
* OS: Kubuntu 14.04 Linux satriani 4.9.119-first-custom #1 SMP Mon Aug 13 18:33:19 +07 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
* Python Version (python --version): 3.6.3 
* Environment (output of `pip freeze`):

websockets==5.0.1
zeroconf==0.23.0


### What is wrong?

According to https://py-evm.readthedocs.io/en/latest/guides/quickstart.html I should install py-evm in my own virtual environment under Python 3.6.3 for my Ubuntu (Kubuntu 14.04) environment. 

Unfortunately the install fails complaining about a missing "snappy-c.h" file that is included.


sudo apt-get install libsnappy-dev
